intro: Bergia anagalloides, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Bergia anagalloides is well adapted to harsh climates and is often found in alpine or coastal regions.
